awd_titl_txt: Applications of Modern Instrumentation to the Advanced      Chemistry Laboratory
awd_abstract_narration: This project allows the chemistry department of Bemidji State                   University to improve and modernize its advanced undergraduate                  laboratory instrumentation.  The goal of this project is to expose the          advanced laboratory students to state of the art instrumentation.  The          acquisition of an HPLC, a fraction collector, a rotary evaporator, and          a freeze dryer allows students in advanced organic lab to isolate and           identify biologically active compounds from plant sources.  This                "chemistry project" is a one quarter long chemistry experiment where            the students learn advanced techniques in extractions, separations,             bioassay methodologies, and organic structure elucidation.  The                 acquired instrumentation is also used in biochemistry, immunology, and          instrumental labs.                                                                                                                                              The institution is matching the NSF grant with an equal amount of               funds.
